sentence.Network_en: Top supermarkets are to ban many genetically modified foods.
sentence.Network_cn: 大品牌超市即将下架许多转基因食品。

sentence.Network_en: We are all genetically programmed to develop certain illnesses.
sentence.Network_cn: 基因决定了我们都会患上某些疾病。

sentence.Network_en: All the bees in the colony are genetically related.
sentence.Network_cn: 同一群体的蜜蜂都有亲缘关系.

entry.def: You use genetic to describe something that is concerned with genetics or with genes.

example.ex: Cystic fibrosis is the most common fatal genetic disease in the United States.
example.tran: 囊性纤维化是美国最常见的致命遗传疾病。

auth_sentence.content: Hoarding and OCD seem to be genetically distinct too.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hoarding and OCD seem to be genetically distinct too.

auth_sentence.content: To boost production, he uses genetically modified seeds.

Sentence.sentence: But Monsanto, the agricultural giant, insists it has a patent on the kind of genetically modified seeds Bowman used―and that the patent continues to all of the progeny (后代)of those seeds.
They argue that when a company like Monsanto goes to great expense to create a valuable new genetically modified seed, it must be able to protect its property interests

This case gives the court an opportunity to rein in the growing use of patents to protect genetically engineered crops and other life forms―but the court may well use it to give this trend a powerful new endorsement.
